title: Home
content:
OpenTextTM Service Management is a service management solution driven by analytics. It combines four key application areas: 

  • IT Service Management (ITSM) supports organizations to do service management for IT use cases.
  • Extended Service Management (XSM) supports organizations to do service management for non-IT use cases, commonly in departments such as HR, Facilities, or Legal. It also includes Customer Service Management (CSM), which helps organizations efficiently support customers who have purchased their products. The experience and execution of XSM is very similar to IT Service Management
  • IT Asset Management (ITAM) helps organizations to manage their hardware and software assets, optimize spend, ensure compliance, and consolidate Asset Management for projects. 
  • Cloud Management offers the Design and Deploy (DND) and Cloud Cost Reporting capabilities. DND makes new cloud service offerings based on published service designs available to consumers, which facilitates the organization's cloud infrastructure management; Cloud Cost Reporting enables customers to monitor their cloud spending and simplify configuration with various cloud providers.

Service Management has fully functioning out-of-the-box processes and workflows that are ready for use as of day 1. The solution allows for a further extension of applications via an easily extendable and fully codeless studio functionality. We and our partner and customer community can share such extended applications via the ITOM Marketplace.

Service Management is offered as a service (SaaS), you can also deploy it on-premises or in the cloud (click here for a free trial). Additionally, the multi-tenancy of Service Management allows you to host and manage environments for multiple customers within a single installation. 

Service Management is offered in the license editions of Service Management Express and Service Management Premium. You need a Cloud Management license if you would like to include Cloud Management capability in Service Management. Asset Management is offered as an Asset Management edition. For more details, see Service Management suite license.

If you are a Service Manager customer and would like to use the Service Portal, you can deploy the solution in mixed mode. For more information, see SMA-SM help center. 

Documentation

Section Description
Release notes

Before you start using features in this release, learn What's new in the release, and review the Enhancements and Fixed issues. The release notes also provides you with a list of Known issues with links to related workarounds. Don't miss the Deprecation and Obsolescence notices to understand which features are no longer being actively developed or are no longer supported.
Get started Understand the concepts of Service Management and its key capabilities. Based on your choice of license, understand which product capabilities you're entitled to. Use cases help you understand how to leverage the product capabilities to meet your business needs. For an exhaustive terminology, see Glossary.  
Install Plan your deployment, prepare the environment, install prerequisite software, and deploy the application on AWS (EKS), Azure (AKS), BYOK, OpenShift, or embedded Kubernetes.
Upgrade Upgrade the application to the latest release. Upgrade the application deployed using a managed Kubernetes distribution or deployed on-premises using the embedded Kubernetes.
Integrate Integrate with our own products or third-party products to extend the capabilities of the application. 
Administer

Set up tenants and users, manage licenses, and complete other configurations. Common administration tasks include Configure suite in Suite Administration, Administer OMT, Perform ongoing maintenance of the suite, Administer Smart Analytics, Administer Service Management, Administer Operation Orchestration, Administer Cloud Management, and more. 
Use Understand how to use various features of the application. Common tasks include Log in to the suite, Use Service Portal, Use the Service Portal mobile app, Use IT Service Management, Use Extended Service Management, Use Asset Management, Use Cloud Management, Use OO Containerized, and more. 
Troubleshoot Find information on how to troubleshoot problems you may experience while using Service Management. This section describes how to Troubleshoot installation, Troubleshoot upgrade, Troubleshoot Suite Administration, Troubleshoot integration, Troubleshoot Service Management, Troubleshoot Service Portal, Troubleshoot DND, Troubleshoot Cloud Cost Reporting, Troubleshoot content store, Troubleshoot Operations Orchestration, Troubleshoot UD/UCMDB, and many more.
Develop Use REST APIs to access and update records or consume REST services from a task or business rules in Service Management.
